results.title: Hungry Ghosts
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Zi Zhong Wang and Barbara Mariotti
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.

results.title: Hungry angels
results.creator_credit: Reimon Productions, Carlos M. Monson Malice and Marcel Reichenbach
results.brief_description: Instructional film dealing with issue of malnutrition. Follows cases of three children - Maria, born to country peasants; Pedro, child of an urban single mother; and Carlos, the baby of a middle-class couple. As a result of poverty and ignorance, the first two children grow up constantly ill with dysentry and other ailments until, several years later, they are taken to hospital, close to death. The third child is fed well,has regular checkups and grows up healthy and happy.

results.title: Hunger = La Faim
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jordan and Peter Foldes
results.brief_description: Computer animated satire of self-indulgence in a hungry world. Rapidly dissolving, reshaping images, made with the aid of a computer, create a stark contrast between abundance and want. A man eats, at first sparingly, but his appetite grows to gluttony, greed, and gratification of every desire. The nightmare that finally haunts him is the one that hangs over our disparate world. A film without words. Animation, Nestor Burtnyk, Marceli Wein and Peter Foldes. Music, Pierre F. Brault. Editing, Pierre Lemelin.

results.title: Hungary and Czechoslovakia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Travel, Travel”.
The video takes us on a detailed journey of the two jewels of Central Europe: Budapest and Prague. We start off in Budapest and travel the historic walls of the city that is nourished by the beautiful Danube River. Travelling outside the city we are shown Hungary’s world-famous mineral springs that for centuries have seen visits by European royalty and artists. In the second half of the video we see the sights of Prague in Czechoslovakia, arguably one of the most visually aesthetic of cities on the planet. We visit famous castles and galleries, as well as take walks around the surrounding beauty of the Bohemian countryside.

results.title: Hundred penny box
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Pieter Van Deusen and Leah Miller
results.brief_description: An extraordinary moving story about Michael, his hundred year old great-great Aunt Dew, and his mother, and the “big ugly old box”. The box holds a small sack with a hundred pennies, each a memory of a year of Aunt Dew’s life. Michael likes to count the pennies and listen to the stories that each year evokes. When his mother, burdened by the care of a failing old lady who disrupts the order of her house, wants to get rid of the big ugly old box, Michael is fiercely defiant. His small boy understanding of Aunt Dew is vastly greater than his mother’s. Based on the book by Sharon Bell Mathis.

results.title: Humphrey Jennings Compilation
results.brief_description: A compilation of works by Humphrey Jennings. “Fires Were Started”: Jenning’s only semi-documentary feature about a waterfront fire service station during the blitz in London. “Listen to Britain”: production of the sights and sounds of people at war, without commentary. “Words for Battle”: spoken. “True story of Lili Marlene”: dramatic reconstruction of the British counter-propaganda campaign against the popular German forces programme from Belgrade Radio.

results.title: Humphrey in the snow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Here’s Humphrey”.
Join Humphrey on his first visit to the snow where he learns to ski, goes for a ride on a skiddoo, makes a model reindeer with Jodie and plays with snowballs. Humphrey in the snow will delight young children as it is a program filled with fun, games and excitement.

results.title: Human rights video kit. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Education Department of Western Australia and Keith Saggers
results.brief_description: Highlights the problems associated with the protection of basic human rights as experienced trough the work of Ammesty International and similar organizations. Part 1 Dramatizes what it would be like to be an adolescent whose human rights were completely removed. Part 2 Provides a case history of a person detained without reason for helping student dissenters.
